intro: Desmostachya bipinnata, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery-white leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a distinctive, feathery appearance. Desmostachya bipinnata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
